newsitem.title: TAIWAN: Taiwan BSPA to tender for 54,000 tonnes soybeans.
newsitem.headline: Taiwan BSPA to tender for 54,000 tonnes soybeans.

text.p: The Taichung division of Taiwan's Breakfast Soybean Procurement Association will tender on Thursday for a 54,000-tonne shipment of U.S. or Argentine soybeans, traders said on Wednesday.

Traders said the Taichung group was waiting to set further specifications for the shipment pending the outcome of a tender on Wednesday by the rival Kaohsiung division of the Breakfast Soybean Procurement Association.

"The Taichung group is still waiting for the outcome of the Kaohsiung tender," said one trader close to the situation. "They could cancel the tender if Kaohsiung group passes or they could change the tender to specify Brazilian soybeans."
The Kaohsiung group was seeking 54,000 tonnes of soybeans sourced in the United States, Argentina, Brazil or Paraguay.
The two groups, which have operated independently for decades, are fiercely competitive with one often arranging tenders on the basis of what price the other gets.
